Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
Back in 1966, in Marseilles, when the world was talking about Start Trek 🚀, Sodexo was serving its first customers, initiating our journey in the Quality-of-Life Services leaded by the bold Pierre Bellon.




Since then, we continued our adventure of offering everyday need solutions, improving the life of our users across the globe 🌎 supported by more than 400 thousand dedicated and brave colleagues, in 64 countries, that lead us to where we are today.




🇵🇹 Portugal is no exception and 5 years ago, our shared service center – Sodexo Business Services – SBS, was born! In here, you will have the chance to be part of several 📊🧾Financial teams like Record to Report, Order to Cash, Purchase to Pay, Financial Analysis, Master Data, among others, that support European markets, making sure the business continues to growth.







💥 Are you bold enough to join our crew, with your unique character and ideas, and make us even bigger?




💼 We are waiting for you! And so, your career!




In the meantime, check the opportunity below:




Senior Data Analyst




This position is responsible for gathering, analyzing, and interpreting complex data to help drive strategic decisions and optimize business processes. The role involves transforming raw data into actionable insights, developing reports and dashboards, and supporting the organization in identifying trends and opportunities for growth.




⚙ What will you do?

Primary tasks:

Create, restructure, and manage large datasets, files, and systems.
Develop clear and actionable visualizations through Power BI dashboards.
Filter, clean, and validate data, ensuring data accuracy and implementing performance indicators to identify and correct issues.
Identify, analyze, and interpret trends or patterns in complex datasets with minimal guidance.
Present her/his findings to stakeholders in a clear and concise communication.




Secondary tasks:

Work closely with management to prioritize business and information needs.
Build stakeholder understanding of data usage and its impact on business decisions.
Apply business logic to guide analysis, synthesize findings, and deliver clear, actionable insights.
Follow standardized processes established by the Sodexo Data Factory.
Document data processing decisions and summarize data quality in technical memos.Support implementation of continuous improvement processes for stakeholders.
Continuously enhance technical skills and explore new technologies to stay current with industry advancements.




🤙 What you'll need to succeed?:

Bachelor’s degree in statistics, mathematics, economics, education, social sciences, or related fields required with two or more years of relevant work experience. Master’s degree preferred.
5/8 years of experience as a Data Analyst or in a similar , with a record of analyzing large datasets and delivering actionable insights.
Strong experience in using business intelligence tools, especially Power BI for data visualization and reporting.
Proficient in data manipulation and query languages, particularly SQL.
Strong knowledge of DBT, Databricks, or other data transformation & pipeline tools.
Proven ability to translate business needs into data models and analytics solutions.
Prior experience working in a data-driven environment and contributing to decision-making through analytics
Strong analytical skills with attention to detail and accuracy.
Strong problem-solving abilities with the capacity to approach complex data challenges methodically.
Excellent communication skills to explain data insights and their business impact to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
Ability to work independently and manage multiple tasks while maintaining clear focus on business outcomes.
A proactive mindset with a passion for continuous learning and staying updated on new technologies and methodologies.




🎉 What we have to offer you?

Hybrid working model;
Flexible working hours;
Health & Life Insurance;
Attractive Meal allowance paid in Meal Card;
Additional Days off: extra vacation day, employee’s birthday, volunteering day;
More than 6000 free online courses;
Opportunity to grow professionally inside the Company;
Possibility to participate in multicultural projects;
Several internal activities aiming to promote our team´s wellbeing.




We are waiting for you!




Send us your CV to our email Recruitment.SBS.Portugal@sodexo.com with the title of the role on the subject and check all the opportunities on our career website (https://www.sodexo.com/en/contact-us/sbs-porto/porto-jobs)




Find out more about Sodexo: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=XX7PoE9kazU




Sodexo is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment.

At Sodexo we believe in Privacy and your Privacy is very important to us that´s why your personal data will only be used for the purpose of managing our recruitment process, will be processed in accordance to the GDPR and treated confidentially. For further information about how we process your personal data please reach out to privacy.sbs@sodexo.com.

🤙 What you'll need to succeed?:

  • Bachelor’s degree in statistics, mathematics, economics, education, social sciences, or related fields required with two or more years of relevant work experience. Master’s degree preferred.
  • 5/8 years of experience as a Data Analyst or in a similar , with a record of analyzing large datasets and delivering actionable insights.
  • Strong experience in using business intelligence tools, especially Power BI for data visualization and reporting.
  • Proficient in data manipulation and query languages, particularly SQL.
  • Strong knowledge of DBT, Databricks, or other data transformation & pipeline tools.
  • Proven ability to translate business needs into data models and analytics solutions.
  • Prior experience working in a data-driven environment and contributing to decision-making through analytics
  • Strong analytical skills with attention to detail and accuracy.
  • Strong problem-solving abilities with the capacity to approach complex data challenges methodically.
  • Excellent communication skills to explain data insights and their business impact to both technical and non-technical stakeholders.
  • Ability to work independently and manage multiple tasks while maintaining clear focus on business outcomes.
  • A proactive mindset with a passion for continuous learning and staying updated on new technologies and methodologies.


  • 🎉 What we have to offer you?

    • Hybrid working model;
    • Flexible working hours;
    • Health & Life Insurance;
    • Attractive Meal allowance paid in Meal Card;
    • Additional Days off: extra vacation day, employee’s birthday, volunteering day;
    • More than 6000 free online courses;
    • Opportunity to grow professionally inside the Company;
    • Possibility to participate in multicultural projects;
    • Several internal activities aiming to promote our team´s wellbeing.


    We are waiting for you!


    Send us your CV to our email Recruitment.SBS.Portugal@sodexo.com with the title of the role on the subject and check all the opportunities on our career website (https://www.sodexo.com/en/contact-us/sbs-porto/porto-jobs)


    Find out more about Sodexo: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=XX7PoE9kazU


    Sodexo is committed to creating a diverse environment and is proud to be an equal opportunity employer. All qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment.

    At Sodexo we believe in Privacy and your Privacy is very important to us that´s why your personal data will only be used for the purpose of managing our recruitment process, will be processed in accordance to the GDPR and treated confidentially. For further information about how we process your personal data please reach out to privacy.sbs@sodexo.com.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
EXPERIS, a Global Leader in Talent Management Solutions, is currently recruiting for the position of Data Analyst (Continuous improvement department), for Gestamp.




Gestamp is a Spanish Industrial Company, Global Leader in the design, development, and manufacturing of metal components for the Automotive Industry.




Listed on the stock exchange since 2017, Gestamp operates in 24 Countries with a workforce of over 45,000 employees. It boasts a diverse, committed, and entrepreneurial team that drives its rapid and sustainable growth.




Currently, Gestamp is establishing a new Shared Services Center for Procurement Management to serve all of Europe, in Porto (Maia). This center will be a strategic pillar for optimizing procurement operations and supplier management, improving efficienc and ensuring the quality of procurement processes with an end-to-end vision.




We are looking for a profile to develop the position of Continuous Improvement Specialist.

Their main responsibilities will involve driving process optimization and operational efficiency.




Main Information:

Proficiency in English (Mandatory)
Proficiency in other Languages (plus)
Knowledge of process automation, with a focus on improving business operations
Proficiency in data analysis tools such as SAP, Excel, and Power BI
Collaborating with technical teams, particularly IT and development




The overview of the role involves identifying and proposing improvements in processes, ensuring optimal efficiency. This involves analyzing areas for improvement, designing and delivering training on tools, leading implementation tests to ensure the effectiveness of new processes and tools.




Hibrid Work Model (2 days Homeoffice/Week)




This is a new project that the company undertakes with great enthusiasm, seeking resolute, flexible, optimistic, and entrepreneurial individuals who enjoy the challenges and rewards of new beginnings. Gestamp is building the future of mobility and is looking for people to join this exciting challenge with their talent.




Are you up for the challenge?

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
We’re looking for the special, unique and amazing YOU!

@ KCS IT, we look for the ones that stands out, for those that always wants to be better and fight for it, and for those who has the same values that we do: dedication, energy, integrity, transparency, flexibility, trust, honesty, hard work, proactivity, team work.

At KCS we stand for equality and value diversity. We create a safe, diverse environment where opportunities are equal for everyone! We do not discriminate based on age, ethnicity, sexual orientation, gender, disability or any factor other than merit. All applications with skills for the position are welcome!




We are looking for an Amazing: Data Analyst

Seniority: 3+ years

Location : Hybrid- Porto




Skills Needed?




Bachelor / Master in Computer Engineering or similar;
3+ years of experience in data analysis;
Strong proficiency in SQL for querying and data extraction;
Experience with data visualization tools (e.g., Power BI, Tableau, Looker);
Experience working with python;
Familiarity with databases such as MySQL, PostgreSQL, or Snowflake;
Strong analytical and problem-solving skills,
Good level of English and Portuguese;
Good level of french is a plus;
The candidate has to be in Portugal.







Why should you become part of our family?




You can develop a career that fits you: your career development is personalized, taking in consideration your needs and goals from a short to long term
Interesting Challenges Ahead: you can work for several clients from different sectors of activity
Free training programs: Our training and certification programs in languages, tech, behavior and business will help you to reach your full potential faster
International projects in Benelux: you can gain international experience in Benelux and balance a new way of living with work
Type of projects (depending on the project you might find one of this types of projects):
In hybrid Systems: Is important to balance work with socialization, that´s why a hybrid system works for us and for you
Full Remote projects: If you want to work while you enjoy the comfort of your home
Full Onsite projects: if you prefere the company of your colleagues!
Take care of your well-being: Enjoy our free nutrition, psicologist, general medicine appointments and our yoga and personal training days… all remote!







Who are we?

Founded in 2008 and based in Lisbon, KCS IT is a consulting company in the field of Information Technology and Services, focused on creating value for our clients through three main areas: Consulting, Outsourcing, Inovation and Training. Our commitment to talent development is unmistakable in the recent opening of the Porto, Leiria and Azores hubs, which aims to develop technology for the national and international market. Since 2018 we have been elected one of the 10 major companies in the “Index of Excellence”, an initiative that aims to reward organizations that invest most in the development and satisfaction of their employees.We believe transparency, trust and integrity are the pillars of any business and relationship and that is what we promise our clients and employees who join our company KCS IT.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
🤔Who are we?




As the founding entity of RAINBOW PARTNERS, Quanteam is a consulting firm specializing in the fields of Banking, Finance, and Financial Services. Guided by our core values of closeness, teamwork, diversity, and excellence, our team of 980 expert consultants, representing 35 different nationalities, collaborates across 10 international offices: Paris, Lyon, New York, Montreal, London, Brussels, Geneva, Lisbon, Porto and Casablanca. Committed to sustainability (Ecovadis Gold), diversity (gender index: 92%), and quality of work life (Best Workplace Experience), Quanteam is a forward-thinking enterprise.




🚀 Our Expertise




With a dual expertise in both business and IT, Quanteam supports its corporate clients (investment banks, asset management companies, private and retail banks, custodians, etc.) across the entire Front-to-Back spectrum in evolving their business activities and transformation projects.




Our teams are organized into 5 expertise areas:

➡ Quantitative Finance

➡ Risk, Compliance, and Regulatory

➡ Operations and Finance

➡ Transformation and Organization

➡ Information Systems

In 2023, Quanteam generated a revenue of €74.6 million.




🔎We are looking for a Data Analyst.




MAIN TASKS:




Design and define data loading and transformation processes for ODS, Data Warehouse, and Data Mart.
Conduct rigorous testing during the acceptance phase.
Analyze and resolve data quality issues across the data supply chain.
Model data in SSAS tabular cubes and Power BI semantic models.
Ensure data integrity and security from source to integration.




YOUR PROFILE AND SKILLS:




Proficiency in Business Intelligence modeling (ODS, DWH, DTM)
Expertise in Oracle and SQL language
Experience in data modeling and preparation using SSAS (Visual Studio Professional)
Proficiency in Power BI
Advanced knowledge of DAX
Fluent in English.
Hybrid role based in Porto.







🚀If you feel this opportunity is for you, send your CV and join our team!

Title: Business Intelligence Analyst - BI
Description:
We’re looking for the special, unique and amazing YOU!

@ KCS IT, we look for the ones that stands out, for those that always wants to be better and fight for it, and for those who has the same values that we do: dedication, energy, integrity, transparency, flexibility, trust, honesty, hard work, proactivity, team work.

Seniority: Mid (3-5 years)

Type of position: Hybrid model in Oporto. Candidates need to be already living in Portugal!

The amazing you, will have:


Previous experience (2 to 5 years) with Power BI and its advanced features;
Solid knowledge of SQL for queries, data manipulation and modeling;
Experience in dimensional and relational data modeling;
DAX proficiency for creating KPIs and custom metrics;
Knowledge of ETL tools, preferably Power Query;
Understanding of data governance and security concepts in BI;

Analytical skills and ability to tell stories with data;

English level C1.

Title: Business Intelligence (BI)
Description:
Decskill, founded in 2014 as an IT Consulting Company, places paramount importance on its greatest asset: its people. Our main mission is to deliver value through knowledge and talent, and we achieve this by fostering a culture of excellence and investing in the development and well-being of our people. With over 600 dedicated professionals and offices in Lisbon, Porto, Madrid, and Luxembourg, Decskill operates across three core areas:




DECSKILL TALENT: We believe that our people are key to our success. Through Decskill Talent, we empower our team to embrace the digital transformation challenges of our clients. We collaborate with clients to drive innovation, ensuring project success and business growth.
DECSKILL BOOST: Equipping our team with the latest tools and methodologies, we optimize Time-to-Market and deliver innovative solutions exceeding client expectations.
DECSKILL CONNECT: Our team collaborates closely with clients to implement and manage IT infrastructures that generate long-term value.




At Decskill, we believe that by nurturing and empowering our people to confront the challenges of digital transformation, we create value not only for our clients but also for our entire ecosystem, fostering a digital community dedicated to growth and progress.




We are looking for an Business Intelligence (BI)!




Mission: We are looking for a Business Intelligence (BI) Analyst with intermediate experience to work on data extraction, modeling, analysis and visualization using the Microsoft stack. The professional will be responsible for developing interactive dashboards, generating strategic insights and supporting decision-making through reliable and well-structured data.




Responsabilities:

Developing interactive reports and dashboards in Power BI.
Creating and optimizing queries in SQL Server for data extraction and processing.
Working with DAX for data modeling and metrics creation.
Performing ETL using Power Query.
Ensuring the quality and integrity of the data extracted and presented.
Collaborating with different areas of the business to understand needs and transform requirements into BI solutions.
Implementing good BI governance and security practices within the Microsoft environment.




Requirements:

Previous experience (2 to 5 years) with Power BI and its advanced features.
Solid knowledge of SQL for queries, manipulation and data modeling.
Experience in dimensional and relational data modeling.
Mastery of DAX for creating KPIs and custom metrics.
Knowledge of ETL tools, preferably Power Query.
Understanding of data governance and security concepts in BI.
Ability to work with large volumes of data and performance optimization.
Analytical skills and the ability to storytell with data.
Good communication skills and the ability to interact with stakeholders from different areas.
Good level of english.




If you’re interested in this job, please send your CV to cesaltina.abreu@decskill.com with reference “CA/BI”




Thank You! 😊




Decskill is committed to equality and non-discrimination with all our talents. We recruit and promote talent, based on diversity and inclusion, regardless of age, gender, ethnicity, race, nationality or any other form of discrimination incompatible with the dignity of the human being.

Title: Data & Shopper Insights Analyst (m/f)
Description:
Há mais de duas décadas que a @Lactogal se assume como uma empresa de pessoas para pessoas, reconhecida por produzir alimentos com os mais altos padrões de qualidade, capazes de responder às necessidades das pessoas, promover o seu bem-estar e ajudá-las nas suas vidas.

Temos uma oportunidade para fazeres parte de uma equipa dinâmica, empenhada na inovação, comprometida com o ambiente e com as comunidades onde está inserida e focada no bem alimentar.

Candidata-te!

Data & Shopper Insights Analyst (m/f) para reforçar a equipa Comercial– Gestão de Categorias na nossa Sede no Porto

RESPONSABILIDADES


Gerir plataformas de dados de clientes, apoiando a construção de informações com medidas de vendas e comportamento de compra, tanto online como offline.
Elaborar relatórios e análises ad-hoc sobre vendas e comportamento de compra.
Monitorar o desempenho das categorias e clientes, identificando oportunidades com base em insights sobre consumidores.
Desenvolver e manter dashboards de performance das categorias e realizar análises ad-hoc para gerar insights e apoiar decisões de gestão.
Analisar o mercado dos consumidores e compradores das categorias Lactogal, bem como dos clientes e do contexto do retalho alimentar.
Conhecer o perfil e comportamento de compra dos consumidores, utilizando informações de shopper insights.



REQUISITOS


Licenciatura em Economia, Gestão, Marketing ou semelhante
Experiência de 3 anos em Funções de gestão, com responsabilidades semelhantes e em empresas comparáveis com a Lactogal (dimensão, sector de atividade, volume de negócio, diversidade/complexidade de processos)
Experiência em Excel (obrigatório)
Experiência em Power BI (obrigatório)



O QUE OFERECEMOS


Remuneração ajustada à função e às qualificações
Contrato de trabalho sem termo
Benefícios em vigor na empresa (flexibilidade horária, seguro de saúde, possibilidade de dias de férias adicionais, entre outros)



Vem trabalhar connosco para o Bem Alimentar.

  • Licenciatura em Economia, Gestão, Marketing ou semelhante
  • Experiência de 3 anos em Funções de gestão, com responsabilidades semelhantes e em empresas comparáveis com a Lactogal (dimensão, sector de atividade, volume de negócio, diversidade/complexidade de processos)
  • Experiência em Excel (obrigatório)
  • Experiência em Power BI (obrigatório)


O QUE OFERECEMOS

  • Remuneração ajustada à função e às qualificações
  • Contrato de trabalho sem termo
  • Benefícios em vigor na empresa (flexibilidade horária, seguro de saúde, possibilidade de dias de férias adicionais, entre outros)


Vem trabalhar connosco para o Bem Alimentar.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Decskill, founded in 2014 as an IT Consulting Company, places paramount importance on its greatest asset: its people. Our main mission is to deliver value through knowledge and talent, and we achieve this by fostering a culture of excellence and investing in the development and well-being of our people. With over 600 dedicated professionals and offices in Lisbon, Porto, Madrid, and Luxembourg, Decskill operates across three core areas:




Decskill Talent: We believe that our people are key to our success.

Through Decskill Talent, we empower our team to embrace the digital transformation challenges of our clients. We collaborate with clients to drive innovation, ensuring project success and business growth.




Decskill Boost: Equipping our team with the latest tools and methodologies, we optimize Time-to-Market and deliver innovative solutions exceeding client expectations.




Decskill Connect: Our team collaborates closely with clients to implement and manage IT infrastructures that generate long-term value.




At Decskill, we believe that by nurturing and empowering our people to confront the challenges of digital transformation, we create value not only for our clients but also for our entire ecosystem, fostering a digital community dedicated to growth and progress.




We are looking for a Data Analyst for a hybrid project in Porto (twice a week in the office).




Requirements:

• 6 to 9 years' experience

• Proficiency in Business Intelligence modeling (ODS, DWH, DTM)

• Ability to write specifications and documentation

• Expertise in Oracle and SQL language

• Experience in data modeling and preparation using SSAS (Visual Studio Professional) and Power BI

• Advanced knowledge of DAX

• Fluent in English (both written and verbal) (mandatory)

• The candidate must be living in Portugal (mandatory)




If you’re interested in this job please send your CV in English.




Decskill is committed to equality and non-discrimination with all our talents. We recruit and promote talent, based on diversity and inclusion, regardless of age, gender, ethnicity, race, nationality or any other form of discrimination incompatible with the dignity of the human being.

Title: Data Analyst
Description:
Are you driven by Technology? 🔴




If so, it's at Red IT that you should embrace your next challenge! We took our first steps in Innovation and Technology in 2016, and the desire to do more and better is always with us.

Red.it stands as a key element within Group RIT, a collaboration of technological enterprises focused on accelerating business growth through digital transformation. Our teams are experienced and certified IT professionals that work closely with clients, to provide fit-for-purpose solutions. From software development, next-generation cloud services, support in IT projects across multiple technological stacks, IT outsourcing, and many more, Group RIT will use the most advanced technology to accelerate and unleash the full potential of our client's business. With 6 Business Units, 11 offices in 8 countries and a global team of over 500 people, Group RIT is leading digital innovation, providing innovative solutions for multiple business sectors like Telecom, Healthcare, Finance, Retail and Manufacturing.




Red.it is dedicated to fostering a workplace that embraces diversity and inclusion. As an equal opportunity employer, it does not discriminate based on race, national origin, gender, gender identity, sexual orientation, disability, age, or any other legally protected status. We believe in creating an environment where all individuals are respected and valued for their unique perspectives and contributions.




Join the Wolfpack as a Data Analyst (Hybrid - Porto) ! 🐺







What skills do you need to have?




Bachelor's degree in Engineering/Computing/Science or similar field.
4 years' experience in data preparation and reconciliation.
Proficiency in Alteryx, VBA and SQL.
Availability for occasional travel.
Fluency in English:
French is highly valued.







Some of your responsibilities will be:




Collaborate with business users to solve business problems.
Develop and maintain Alteryx workflows for data processing.
Ensure compliance with software governance rules.
Estimate and manage data project tasks.







A team focused on achieving objectives, motivation will not be lacking! Red Team!

Red Training - We want to help you reach your potential.

Continuous career support and advice. Red Follow Up

Red Change - You love what you do, but want to explore other areas? No problem Wolf!

There is time for everything, and fun is not left out. Red Hours

Red Spirit - If you want to go fast, go alone. If you want to go far, GO TOGETHER!




Keywords: Data Analyst, Alteryx.




WHAT DRIVES YOU?




Apply here or through join.us@redit.pt and find out what moves us at www.redit.pt

Title: Senior Data Analyst
Description:
Company Description

Natixis in Portugal is fully integrated in the global organization of Natixis, a French multinational financial services firm specialized in Asset & Wealth Management, Corporate & Investment Banking, Insurance and Payments. A subsidiary of Groupe BPCE, Natixis counts nearly 16.000 employees across 38 countries.

Based in Porto, Natixis Centre of Expertise mission is to transform traditional banking by developing innovative solutions for the bank’s business, operations and work culture worldwide, as a key driver of the company’s culture of agility and innovation. Teams of IT and Banking Support Activities work in an integrated, inclusive and transversal way, supporting all the business lines and country platforms.

Natixis in Portugal is the best combination of a “start-up mindset” with a large, solid structure. Its unique culture gives true meaning to a “beyond banking” personality: to be a real entrepreneur, self-challenging, ever striving to excel and go that extra mile.

Job Description

Team presentation and main goal:

As part of the Finance Direction, you will integrate the Financial Data Integrity department (FDI) which oversees the labelling of financial data for CIB activities of Natixis (balance sheet and off-balance sheet).

You will join a team of 6 people in Porto.

As a Senior Data Analyst, of a major French banking institution with international dimension, you will:


Support Data Management initiatives for Internal & Regulatory framework toward improvement of the quality of reports produced by Natixis CIB.
Participate in the Data monitoring for CIB activities (Financing, Global market, etc.)


You will be in contact with the other teams of FDI, internal Finance partners and Finance IT teams.

Main tasks and goals:

As a Senior Data Analyst, your primary tasks will be:

1- Data Systems and Analytics:


Develop solutions for data extraction, exploration, and transformation using SQL and other technologies.
Interface between business line and IT to translate business requirements into data sources and queries, supporting the creation of KPI metrics for dashboards.
Design and implement data architectures, along with new dashboards, to enhance business intelligence capabilities.
Manage and improve the use of data visualization tools like Power BI, ensuring the effective presentation of data to stakeholders;.
Own the creation and maintenance of scheduled reporting, including Power BI dashboards, to regularly inform business decisions.


2- Requirements and Coordination:


Oversee the full lifecycle of business requirements, from elicitation and analysis to documentation, management, and solution translation.
Plan and conduct workshops, interviews, and prototyping sessions to collect, clarify, and confirm business requirements.
Coordinate with Finance IT to monitor and prioritize the remediation plans and overall business requirements.
Ensure the effective coordination and implementation of financial issues remediation with relevant committees and IT teams.


3- Data Governance and Strategy (Technical View & Impact):


Participate in the coordination of the Data Domain Office (DDO) network for finance, including involvement in framework committees and data quality frameworks for projects regarding all technical requests.
Contribute to the strategic planning of Data Management roadmap, aiming to align data management practices with business objectives regarding the technical impact.


4- Monitoring and Collaboration:


Monitor the implementation of business requirements and data strategies in collaboration with IT teams.
Support the management and enhancement of data visualization and BI solutions, fostering a culture of data-driven decision making.
Collaborate with various teams to promote cross-functional unity and ensure the seamless integration of technical data insights into business processes.


Additional information:

You will be part of a bi-localized team with a local manager and a functional manager based in Paris, with regular interactions with the Paris team.

The ability to develop a network within the various teams of the Natixis ecosystem, and an aptitude for collaborative and group work are key factors of success in this position.

Qualifications

Qualifications:


Master’s degree in Finance, Math, Data Analytics, Data Science or Data Engineering;
Understanding of Data Governance and Data Management;
Knowledge in BCBS239 and the respective Streams;
Experienced with Finance / Banking Data (Banking environment, regulations, and products)
Advance expertise in Power BI and Tableau is essential, building automated reports and creating data-driven dashboards;
Knowledge of data transformation and analysis tools (Power Query, DAX, Excel, SQL and Python)
Synthesize complex datasets into clear, efficient, fast, useful, and appealing visualizations, dashboards and reports;
Knowledge in Big Data environments and technical tools for data analysis;
Experience with Atlassian Jira (as a plus);
Experience with Power BI Report Builder, Power Automate, and Power Apps (as a plus);
English (mandatory) and French (as a plus).


Soft Skills:


Strong communication and relationship-building skills;
Analytical mindset with problem-solving capabilities and attention to details;
Understand Business requirement and suggest right architecture;
Curious, proactive, and able to work in a fast-paced environment;
Teamwork orientation and coaching skills to foster a collaborative atmosphere.


Only CV´s in English will be considered.

Additional Information

Early morning. Campo 24 de Agosto. In 4 minutes, you are clocking in at the office. After grabbing a cup of coffee and fresh fruit, pick up your laptop and choose your spot for the day. It's going to be a busy one: French class before lunch and, just after, quick medical appointment at Natixis doctor's office. Lunch break. Outside in the big terrace (look at your crops at the Urban Garden; ready to harvest!) or, if you feel like stretching your legs, walk downtown to grab lunch.

Back inside. Quick sprint review (working together anywhere means virtual happy birthday to that colleague in Paris that just turned 35). The afternoon went flying (tasks, reports, calls, some jokes with your teammates). End it on a high note: just one PlayStation game or the final match for that ping-pong tournament.

Tomorrow, you complete that certified technical training and the day after, you will work from home, taking advantage to finally do that online course on Udemy. Once you are done with your tasks for the day, you can visit the office for a board games session or show up at the rehearsal of one of Natixis bands. If that is too steady for you, meet your colleagues to surf some waves or join them in a football match.

Title: Analista de Dados (M/F)
HTML:
A Metalogalva, empresa do Vigent Group, que desenvolve a sua atividade, no projeto e fabrico de estruturas metálicas, que têm a sua aplicação em vários domínios de atividade, nomeadamente, energia, telecomunicações, vias rodoviárias, pretende recrutar Analista de Dados (M/F) para a Trofa.


Função:

  • Contribuir ativamente para a transformação digital da empresa, desenvolvendo ferramentas originais em Power BI, Power Apps e Power Automate, alinhadas com as necessidades da organização;
  • Prestar apoio direto à Comissão de Gestão na análise e interpretação de dados;
  • Analisar dados operacionais e contabilísticos, assegurando elevados padrões de fiabilidade;
  • Implementar e garantir boas práticas operacionais, para permitir uma correta escalabilidade da informação;
  • Participar pontualmente em inventários, atuando como auditor interno no fecho de contas;
  • Efetuar o levantamento e análise de informações para resposta a auditorias externas.


Perfil:

  • Licenciatura em Gestão, Contabilidade ou Engenharia;
  • Bons conhecimentos de Inglês (obrigatório);
  • Domínio do Microsoft Excel;
  • Conhecimentos intermédios de Power BI e DAX;
  • Valorizam-se conhecimentos em SQL, Power Apps, Power Automate, SAP e VBA;
  • Forte orientação para objetivos e resultados;
  • Autonomia, resiliência, organização e planeamento;
  • Boa capacidade de relacionamento interpessoal e comunicação.



Oferecemos:

  • Integração num ambiente organizacional desafiante, numa equipa dinâmica e com projetos inovadores;
  • Plano de formação permanente que contempla o desenvolvimento profissional e pessoal;
  • Tipo de oferta: Período Integral.

Title: Data Analyst (HYBRID @Porto)
Description:
We’re looking for the special, unique and amazing YOU!

@ KCS IT, we look for the ones that stands out, for those that always wants to be better and fight for it, and for those who has the same values that we do: dedication, energy, integrity, transparency, flexibility, trust, honesty, hard work, proactivity, team work.

At KCS we stand for equality and value diversity. We create a safe, diverse environment where opportunities are equal for everyone! We do not discriminate based on age, ethnicity, sexual orientation, gender, disability or any factor other than merit. All applications with skills for the position are welcome!




We are looking for an Amazing: Data Analyst

Seniority: +3 years

Type of position: Hybrid (2x/week in Porto)




The amazing you, will have:

Bachelor's degree in Computer Science, Software Engineering, Statistics or Mathematics;
3+ years of experience as Data Analyst;
Proficiency with ETL, SQL, PowerBI and Alteryx;
Experience with Jaspersoft, VBA, API, Python and Tibco Spotfire are nice to have;
Ability to perform database queries;
Excellent problem-solving and critical-thinking skills;
Strong attention to detail and accuracy;
Ability to work collaboratively in a team environment;
Availability for a hybrid regime at Porto (Portugal);
Fluency in English is mandatory.







To turn yourself from amazing to unique, you´ll have (plus):

Comfort speaking French.




Why should you become part of our family?

You can develop a career that fits you: your career development is personalized, taking in consideration your needs and goals from a short to long term
Interesting Challenges Ahead: you can work for several clients from different sectors of activity
Free training programs: Our training and certification programs in languages, tech, behavior and business will help you to reach your full potential faster
International projects in Benelux: you can gain international experience in Benelux and balance a new way of living with work
Type of projects (depending on the project you might find one of this types of projects):
In hybrid Systems: Is important to balance work with socialization, that´s why a hybrid system works for us and for you
Full Remote projects: If you want to work while you enjoy the comfort of your home
Full Onsite projects: if you prefere the company of your colleagues!
Take care of your well-being: Enjoy our free nutrition, psicologist, general medicine appointments and our yoga and personal training days… all remote!




Who are we?

Founded in 2008 and based in Lisbon, KCS IT is a consulting company in the field of Information Technology and Services, focused on creating value for our clients through three main areas: Consulting, Outsourcing, Inovation and Training. Our commitment to talent development is unmistakable in the recent opening of the Porto, Leiria and Azores hubs, which aims to develop technology for the national and international market. Since 2018 we have been elected one of the 10 major companies in the “Index of Excellence”, an initiative that aims to reward organizations that invest most in the development and satisfaction of their employees.

Title: Data Analyst - Finance
Description:
About Us

Planet is a leading technology company transforming payments by putting customer experience first.

We offer integrated solutions that include payment processing, VAT refunds, dynamic currency conversion, and management services for merchants in the Retail and Hospitality sectors worldwide.

In recent years, we have experienced significant growth, expanding our services and global presence.

With strong private equity investors, Advent International and Eurazeo, we have the financial capital and expertise to grow our capabilities and reach through acquisitions.

Our mission is to create a world of connected commerce where payments are simple, secure, and seamless, enabling our partners to deliver exceptional experiences to their customers.

Function Overview

Join our dynamic team as a Data Analyst - Finance, where you'll play a critical role in ensuring accurate commission payouts for a high-performing sales organization. You'll manage everything from commission calculations and reporting to troubleshooting and process improvements, all while collaborating closely with our Sales, Finance and Data teams. This role requires a blend of technical expertise in data engineering and in-depth knowledge of commission structures, ensuring accurate, efficient, and scalable solutions.

If you thrive in a fast-paced environment, have a passion for data accuracy, and enjoy identifying efficiencies, this role is your opportunity to make a meaningful impact. Bring your Excel skills, analytical mindset, and enthusiasm for teamwork to help us deliver exceptional results!

Administration

What you'll do


Responsible for all aspects of day-to-day commission administration resulting in accurate and timely commission payments.
Create, validate and audit monthly reports to ensure accuracy and completeness of commissions crediting and payout results.
Respond to compensation related inquiries from the Sales Team in an effective and timely manner.
Perform configuration, testing and other support activities related to plan, quota, and policy changes
Manage Sales Promotion, bonus and SPIFF payments.
Prepare key monthly commission reconciliation reports including reporting of monthly commission and sales attainment metrics.


Data Engineering And Modelling


Design and implement scalable solutions for the commission’s calculator, ensuring accurate processing of complex commission structures.
Build and maintain robust data pipelines and workflows to support real-time and batch processing of commission data.
Integrate data from multiple sources, such as Salesforce, Snowflake, and legacy systems, to ensure seamless commission calculations.
Develop and maintain data models that support the commission engine’s requirements.


Testing And Validation


Develop rigorous testing frameworks to validate the accuracy of commissions calculations.
Troubleshoot and resolve calculation and/or data errors.
Perform QA and troubleshoot discrepancies in commission results, implementing fixes as needed.
Governance and Collaboration:
Ensure compliance with data governance and security standards in all processes.
Create comprehensive documentation for the commission’s calculator, including workflows, data models, and calculation logic.
Work closely with Finance, Sales, and Data teams to understand commission structures and business requirements.
Collaborate with BI teams to deliver reporting solutions that provide clear visibility into commissions calculations and outcomes.


Governance And Collaboration


Ensure compliance with data governance and security standards in all processes.
Create comprehensive documentation for the commission’s calculator, including workflows, data models, and calculation logic.
Work closely with Finance, Sales, and Data teams to understand commission structures and business requirements.
Collaborate with BI teams to deliver reporting solutions that provide clear visibility into commissions calculations and outcomes.


Who You Are


Education: University educated in Business, Accounting or related field or equivalent work experience.
Commissions: 3+ years' experience in commission processing or business/finance analyst function for a high growth sales team, preferably in the payments or financial services industry.
PowerBI: Advanced expertise in PowerBI is essential, including experience with DAX, building automated reports, and creating complex, data-driven dashboards.
SQL: Strong proficiency in SQL, with experience working with large datasets in a cloud-based environment (Snowflake).
Data Modelling: Experience with data modelling and data pipeline processes (using dbt or equivalent).
Cloud Platforms: Experience with cloud data platforms (Snowflake, Azure as a plus).
ETL: Basic knowledge of ETL processes and experience working with data engineers to contribute to scalable solutions. Familiarity with GitHub for managing code and version control.
Azure: Experience with Azure cloud services.
Python (or Java): Proficiency in programming languages such as Python or Java for building and automating workflows.
Data Governance: Understanding of data governance and security best practices.
Excel: Advanced skills are a requirement.


Nice To Have


Commissions Software: Commission software experience is a plus (ie. Spiff, Xactly, etc.).
Certifications: certification in data engineering or analytics (e.g., Microsoft Certified: Data Engineer, AWS Certified Data Analytics).


Why Planet

Planet is an equal opportunity employer where diversity is valued, and all employment is decided based on qualifications, merit, and business need.

Come and grow your career in the most exciting, fast paced technology market, with a business that delivers feel-good connected commerce. We would love to hear from you – Apply now.

At Planet, we embrace a hybrid work model, with three days a week in the office.

Reasonable accommodations may be made in order to allow for an individual to perform the essential functions of this role successfully.
Show more
HTML:
About Us

Planet is a leading technology company transforming payments by putting customer experience first.

We offer integrated solutions that include payment processing, VAT refunds, dynamic currency conversion, and management services for merchants in the Retail and Hospitality sectors worldwide.

In recent years, we have experienced significant growth, expanding our services and global presence.

With strong private equity investors, Advent International and Eurazeo, we have the financial capital and expertise to grow our capabilities and reach through acquisitions.

Our mission is to create a world of connected commerce where payments are simple, secure, and seamless, enabling our partners to deliver exceptional experiences to their customers.

Function Overview

Join our dynamic team as a Data Analyst - Finance, where you'll play a critical role in ensuring accurate commission payouts for a high-performing sales organization. You'll manage everything from commission calculations and reporting to troubleshooting and process improvements, all while collaborating closely with our Sales, Finance and Data teams. This role requires a blend of technical expertise in data engineering and in-depth knowledge of commission structures, ensuring accurate, efficient, and scalable solutions.

If you thrive in a fast-paced environment, have a passion for data accuracy, and enjoy identifying efficiencies, this role is your opportunity to make a meaningful impact. Bring your Excel skills, analytical mindset, and enthusiasm for teamwork to help us deliver exceptional results!

Administration

What you'll do

  • Responsible for all aspects of day-to-day commission administration resulting in accurate and timely commission payments.
  • Create, validate and audit monthly reports to ensure accuracy and completeness of commissions crediting and payout results.
  • Respond to compensation related inquiries from the Sales Team in an effective and timely manner.
  • Perform configuration, testing and other support activities related to plan, quota, and policy changes
  • Manage Sales Promotion, bonus and SPIFF payments.
  • Prepare key monthly commission reconciliation reports including reporting of monthly commission and sales attainment metrics.

Data Engineering And Modelling

  • Design and implement scalable solutions for the commission’s calculator, ensuring accurate processing of complex commission structures.
  • Build and maintain robust data pipelines and workflows to support real-time and batch processing of commission data.
  • Integrate data from multiple sources, such as Salesforce, Snowflake, and legacy systems, to ensure seamless commission calculations.
  • Develop and maintain data models that support the commission engine’s requirements.

Testing And Validation

  • Develop rigorous testing frameworks to validate the accuracy of commissions calculations.
  • Troubleshoot and resolve calculation and/or data errors.
  • Perform QA and troubleshoot discrepancies in commission results, implementing fixes as needed.
  • Governance and Collaboration:
  • Ensure compliance with data governance and security standards in all processes.
  • Create comprehensive documentation for the commission’s calculator, including workflows, data models, and calculation logic.
  • Work closely with Finance, Sales, and Data teams to understand commission structures and business requirements.
  • Collaborate with BI teams to deliver reporting solutions that provide clear visibility into commissions calculations and outcomes.

Governance And Collaboration

  • Ensure compliance with data governance and security standards in all processes.
  • Create comprehensive documentation for the commission’s calculator, including workflows, data models, and calculation logic.
  • Work closely with Finance, Sales, and Data teams to understand commission structures and business requirements.
  • Collaborate with BI teams to deliver reporting solutions that provide clear visibility into commissions calculations and outcomes.

Who You Are

  • Education: University educated in Business, Accounting or related field or equivalent work experience.
  • Commissions: 3+ years' experience in commission processing or business/finance analyst function for a high growth sales team, preferably in the payments or financial services industry.
  • PowerBI: Advanced expertise in PowerBI is essential, including experience with DAX, building automated reports, and creating complex, data-driven dashboards.
  • SQL: Strong proficiency in SQL, with experience working with large datasets in a cloud-based environment (Snowflake).
  • Data Modelling: Experience with data modelling and data pipeline processes (using dbt or equivalent).
  • Cloud Platforms: Experience with cloud data platforms (Snowflake, Azure as a plus).
  • ETL: Basic knowledge of ETL processes and experience working with data engineers to contribute to scalable solutions. Familiarity with GitHub for managing code and version control.
  • Azure: Experience with Azure cloud services.
  • Python (or Java): Proficiency in programming languages such as Python or Java for building and automating workflows.
  • Data Governance: Understanding of data governance and security best practices.
  • Excel: Advanced skills are a requirement.

Nice To Have

  • Commissions Software: Commission software experience is a plus (ie. Spiff, Xactly, etc.).
  • Certifications: certification in data engineering or analytics (e.g., Microsoft Certified: Data Engineer, AWS Certified Data Analytics).

Why Planet

Planet is an equal opportunity employer where diversity is valued, and all employment is decided based on qualifications, merit, and business need.

Come and grow your career in the most exciting, fast paced technology market, with a business that delivers feel-good connected commerce. We would love to hear from you – Apply now.

At Planet, we embrace a hybrid work model, with three days a week in the office.

Reasonable accommodations may be made in order to allow for an individual to perform the essential functions of this role successfully.

Title: Data Analyst (Alteryx)
HTML:
Dellent is a consulting company focused in System Information and Telecommunications. Our goal is to help our candidates and consultants to take a step forward in their careers through projects that meet their needs and expectations.

This project is part of the business investment banking and financial services area, and currently has its technological hub in Porto and is working on the development of innovative solutions and support for all operations related to the business.

We are looking for a Data Analyst (Alteryx) to work in this project in Porto (Hybrid).

Requirements

  • Degree in Computer Engineering, Computer Science, Applied Math, or a similar area;
  • Experience in data preparation and data reconciliation;
  • Proven experience in Alteryx and VBA;
  • Good Knowledge of SQL;
  • +2 years of experience with Alteryx;
  • Availability to travel abroad for short periods of time, as required;
  • Good level of English (mandatory).

We Offer

  • Health insurance;
  • A personalized training plan, with a budget to spend on the training and technical books you find necessary;
  • Constant feedback so you can grow professionally;
  • Remote onboarding process;
  • Team events every semester so you can live new adventures;
  • Culture of proximity and transparency. Your ideas and needs are heard and valued by us!

Apply

If the above sounds like the kind of job opportunity you would want to get involved with, then please do not hesitate to apply here. You can also explore our content about the job market here.

Title: BI Senior Consultant
HTML:
Retail Consult is recruiting!


The impact of technology in retail is a game changer affecting every retailer from small, local shops to retail giants. Working at Retail Consult means being at the center of this industry in transformation. As specialists in technology solutions for retail, we provide solutions strategy, implementation, deployment, training, and support services for clients across a range of retail segments including fashion, grocery, pharmacy, do it yourself, telecommunications, and electronics. Work, train and learn with a growing team with over 300 people based in Portugal, the US, Germany, Brazil, Mexico, Chile, and China, who are transforming the business of retailers across the globe.


We are currently seeking for a BI Senior Consultant to join our growing Delivery team in Porto, Portugal.


What we are offering:


  • The opportunity to join a growing company with people passionate about their work in an international environment;
  • The opportunity to work with best-in-breed methodologies, tools, and techniques;
  • Training and Mentoring/Talent Development programs;
  • Full package of Salary, perks, and benefits (Health Insurance, mobile allowance, and others);
  • Career Evolution;
  • Flexible working hours;
  • Extra days off;
  • Wellbeing program;
  • Partnerships with local businesses.


What you’ll be doing:


  • Play the role of lead Business Intelligence (BI) Consultant in projects focused on implementing Oracle Retail Insights and other BI solutions;
  • Guide clients in best practices for BI/Analytics implementation, ensuring efficient data strategies and reporting structures;
  • Act as a System Integrator (SI), overseeing the successful deployment and integration of BI solutions with existing systems architecture;
  • Participate in business process analysis to understand end-user needs and define optimal BI architectures and workflows;
  • Provide leadership and training to end-users, ensuring clients maximize the value of BI tools;
  • Work closely with cross-functional teams to define and document business requirements, technical specifications, and solution roadmaps;


What we are looking for:


  • Proven experience in BI and Analytics best practices;
  • Experience as a System Integrator (SI) in BI implementations;
  • Strong ability to guide and support clients in the use and adoption of BI platforms;
  • Exposure to and understanding of business processes supported by BI/Analytics solutions;
  • Availability to travel;
  • Excellent communication skills in English.


What would be a plus:


  • Degree in Business, Management, or Engineering-related fields;
  • Experience with Oracle Retail Insights;
  • Knowledge in Oracle BI Cloud stack;
  • Proficiency in Spanish, French or German.


If you think your profile matches our requirements and you are looking for an experience that offers opportunity, growth, balance, and a feeling of value, apply to this job submitting your CV at: www.retail-consult.com/en/work-with-us/ or jobs@retail-consult.com.

Retail Consult – Transforming Retail with Passion

Title: Data Analyst (Engineer)
Description:
About Revolut

People deserve more from their money. More visibility, more control, and more freedom. Since 2015, Revolut has been on a mission to deliver just that. Our powerhouse of products — including spending, saving, investing, exchanging, travelling, and more — help our 50+ million customers get more from their money every day.

As we continue our lightning-fast growth,‌ 2 things are essential to our success: our people and our culture. In recognition of our outstanding employee experience, we've been certified as a Great Place to Work™. So far, we have 10,000+ people working around the world, from our offices and remotely, to help us achieve our mission. And we're looking for more brilliant people. People who love building great products, redefining success, and turning the complexity of a chaotic world into the simplicity of a beautiful solution.

About The Role

We approach Data Science at Revolut the same way that we approach everything else. We take complex problems, and create extraordinary solutions that our customers love. Our Data Analysts aren’t kept in the background, doomed to never see the impact of their work. They’re some of our best and brightest problem solvers, deployed to the front-lines to work in Product Teams and deliver rock star solutions.

We’re looking for a superstar Data Analyst who does not believe there is a data task that can be too hard. From digging into our complex databases, looking for the root cause of a problem to designing their own solutions and writing their own code to implement them. In this process they never stop learning, picking up new skills and delivering value ✨

Up for the challenge? Get in touch 🚀

What You’ll Be Doing


Understanding our business and its processes through our data
Applying this understanding and knowledge of data to help product and services teams
Developing documentation and data governance
Owning the entire ETL process
Designing key metrics to measure different aspects of the business
Creating and maintaining new aggregated views and tables to simplify data querying
Providing clean data sets to end users, modeling data in a way that empowers end users to answer their own questions


What You'll Need


5+ years of professional experience in an analytical role, creating impactful data-driven solutions
Excellent background/education in a quantitative discipline
Great skills with Python, SQL, or other programming languages
Evidence of exceptional mathematical and statistics knowledge


Nice to have


An advanced degree in a core STEM subject
Excellent experience with additional programming languages (Java, Scala, C++, etc.)
School/University Olympic medal competitions in Physics, Maths, Economics, or Programming


Building a global financial super app isn’t enough. Our Revoluters are a priority, and that’s why in 2021 we launched our inaugural D&I Framework, designed to help us thrive and grow everyday. We're not just doing this because it's the right thing to do. We’re doing it because we know that seeking out diverse talent and creating an inclusive workplace is the way to create exceptional, innovative products and services for our customers. That’s why we encourage applications from people with diverse backgrounds and experiences to join this multicultural, hard-working team.

Refer to our <a class="postings-link" href="https://www.revolut.com/legal/data-privacy-for-candidates">Data Privacy Statement for Candidates for details on our data handling practices during your application.

Title: Data & Business Intelligence Officer
Description:
About The Job

Global Markets is BNP Paribas’ capital markets business within Corporate & Institutional Banking (CIB), delivering solutions across asset classes, and industry-leading services for clients including Institutionals, corporates, private banks and retail distribution networks. Our Portugal Platform (Porto and Lisbon) is a major HUB in Europe and certainly unique in the country by its size and its scope of activity, with all Front Office roles present (Trading, Sales, Research, Structuring, Quant & Engineering, Business Dev and Support, Marketing & Client Support, Risk Management, Data Analytics and Machine Learning…). We are growing fast with the ambition to become even more relevant for the worldwide activity, which presents many short and long term opportunities.

Your Main Activities Are

The purpose of the role is to Drive the Business Intelligence for FX+, including (but not limited to) reporting on the activity, tracking of the business case, management of the Revenue Sharing Agreements, pricing and booking models enhancements, business development and tracking of the operational quality.


Monitor the FX Payments activity and the revenue sharing
Monitor activity KPIs (volumes, revenues, pricing …) for all geographies / clients
Manage revenue sharing with TB / DM / IRB partners
Track the FX+ platform performance and operational quality
Support the business development with accurate ad-hoc data analysis (pricing analysis, campaigns targeting and follow-up…)
Build a state of the art industrial “Client Intelligence” solutio
Establish key metrics, reports and alerts and requirements in terms of digital business performance, in close collaboration with the businesses, to measure activity and revenues
Contribute to the management of the product roadmap for Client Intelligence (extension to new activities, new countries, new client segments and needs …)


Profile And Skills To Success


Academic background in Engineering, Mathematics, Finance, Economics or similar areas (preferential)
Experience in a similar Business Intelligence
An overall understanding and interest in the financial world
Strong appetite for Digital technologies, support and foster a culture of continuous improvement
Experienced in defining and sponsoring projects and project management: business case and scoping study, management of the delivery along with Business Lines / IT / Operations
Fluency in English (mandatory)
Excellent communication skills and client focus
Strong team work while being able to work autonomously
Ability to work under tight deadlines and organisational skills
Strong Excel knowledge
Tableau, PowerBI and other IT coding Skills – (Intermediate)
Contribute to the management of the product roadmap for Client Intelligence (extension to new activities, new countries, new client segments and needs Contribute to the management of the product roadmap for Client Intelligence (extension to new activities, new countries, new client segments and needs …)


Why joining BNP Paribas?


Leading banking institution


BNP Paribas is the European Union’s leading bank, and key player in international banking. It operates in 63 countries and has nearly 183.000 employees, including more than 146.000 in Europe.


Our presence in Portugal


In Portugal since 1985, BNP Paribas today has more than 8.700 employees, distributed across the Group's 10 business entities established in the country. Its presence also extends to 11 excellence centres providing value-added services to various countries where the BNP Paribas Group also operates.


International reach


Thanks To Its International Presence And Regular And Close Collaboration Among Its Different Entities, BNP Paribas Has The Resources To Support All Clients With Financing, Investment, Savings And Protection Solutions That Help Make Their Projects a Success. BNP Paribas Holds Key Positions In Its Three Core Operating Divisions


Retail Banking, a division that brings together all of the Group’s retail activities and specialised business lines;
Investment & Protection Services that include specialised businesses offering a wide range of savings, investment and protection services;
Corporate & Institutional Banking division that offers tailored financial solutions for corporate and institutional clients.
Diversity and Inclusion commitment


BNP Paribas is an equal opportunity employer and proud to provide equal employment opportunity to all job seekers. We are actively committed to ensuring that no individual is discriminated against on the grounds of age, disability, gender reassignment, marriage or civil partnership status, pregnancy and maternity/paternity, race, religion or belief, sex or sexual orientation. Equity and diversity are at the core of our recruitment policy because we believe that they foster creativity and efficiency, which in turn increase performance and productivity. We strive to reflect the society we live in, while keeping with the image of our clients.


Commitment towards work/life balance


At BNP Paribas we care about our employees wellbeing and promote a culture of good integration between work and rest. We believe our employees have rich personal lives outside of work, being fundamental to be disconnected from work to recharge both physically and mentally. Only through this balance we may all be at our best while working.


Remote Working Conditions


At BNP Paribas, we embrace a Smart Working framework based on trust, autonomy and collaboration. Within this framework, eligible employees can benefit from flexible remote working modalities adapted to our hybrid working environment. To guarantee a comfortable and efficient working set-up, eligible employees are provided with both the office and home equipment, are entitled to an equipment allowance and can benefit from exclusive partnerships to purchase additional equipment at reduced prices.

To find out more on why you should join BNP Paribas visit https://bnpp.lk/why-BNP-Paribas-Portugal


Please note that only applications submitted in English will be considered.
In case you are selected for this role, further documentation will be requested to support your hiring process.

  • In case you are selected for this role, further documentation will be requested to support your hiring process.

Title: Business Intelligence Associate
Description:
What We Offer


A balanced work environment where you will have autonomy, responsibility, and ownership while working with a vibrant and dynamic team.
A modern office with everything you need (including food and beverages).
Become part of a fast-growing international and diverse team.

Design visually appealing and business useful reports.

Solid understanding and working experience of other BI tools and powerapps.
Profound knowledge of the English language.

Title: Finance Data Operations Analyst
Description:
GuestReady is a leading short-term rental and hospitality services management company, operating in the UK, France, Portugal, Spain, and the UAE. Since our founding in 2016, we’ve aimed to revolutionize the short-term rental industry through innovative technology and a dedication to exceptional hospitality.

An excitingopportunity to join our high-performing team as a driven, ambitious, and adaptable finance data operations analyst, who takes a hands-onapproach to their daily responsibilities of key back-officeprocesses. We are looking for a superstar who can be integral to thefuture of the finance function.

The role will suit anindividual with great analytical skills who wants to gain valuableexperience and exposure in an exciting start-up. This could be youropportunity to join a high-growth company and compete with yourskills, knowledge, and exposure to build yourself and build thecompany simultaneously. This individual will form a core part of theGlobal Finance team, within the FinOps subteam and will beresponsible for the monitoring of our proprietary payment systemensuring a proper flow of the funds from guest to host. This rolewill be based in Portugal but will be working for all our Globalmarkets.




Key Responsibilities:

Daily reconciliation of incoming and outgoing transfers within the payment system (identifying misconfigurations and miscalculations)
Identification of flaws and improvements needed on the flow to ensure the minimum delay in the payouts
Partner with our product team to improve our proprietary payment system
Collaborate with other teams to drive operational efficiency and process improvements
Maintain and improve fin-ops reports
Assist in ad hoc analyses for Finance or other teams




What We’re Looking For:

Based in Porto area
Strong analytical and quantitative skills, particularly using Excel (super user); comfort working with large data sets and the ability to identify data inconsistencies and patterns
Studied advanced mathematics
Project Management skills
SQL knowledge
Comfortable navigating cloud applications
Fluent in English and Portuguese (C1/C2)
Analytical, problem-solving mind
Detail-oriented, with a strong focus on quality
Able to multitask, and prioritize in a fast-paced environment
A proactive hands-on attitude
The ability to work with the highest ethical and professional quality standards
Previous experience working in a startup environment would be an advantage




Why You'll Love Working with Us:

🏡 Hybrid work flexibility (1-2 days/week in Porto).
🚀 Join a fast-growing company in the booming travel industry.
🌍 Work in a dynamic, multicultural team.
📚 Opportunities for learning and career development.
🏥 Comprehensive health insurance.
🧘 Focus on wellbeing with supportive activities.
🐾 Pet-friendly office!

We’re excited to hear from you and discover how you can contribute to our journey!

Don’t worry if you don’t tick every box—if you’re a 70% fit, we still encourage you to apply. Many skills can be learned through experience, and together we can bridge the gaps.

Diversity and Inclusion
At GuestReady, we celebrate diversity and are proud to be an equal-opportunity employer. Our global team thrives on mutual respect and inclusion, valuing unique talents and perspectives. We warmly welcome applicants from all backgrounds, regardless of race, gender, religion, sexual orientation, disability, age, or culture

Title: MDM Analyst
Description:
Job Purpose:




The MDM Analyst role will be responsible for the creation and maintenance of Master Data that is required for finance processes and is leveraged by cross-functional teams under RTR, PTP, OTC, FPA.

The role requires working closely with both Finance process users and everyday system users to create and maintain data at the expected service and quality levels. This role interacts with a wide range of internal stakeholders including other internal and external finance & non-finance teams, senior accountants, and local business finance leads. The role will support the business by understanding and implementing improvements, will assist standardization efforts, while moving towards to standard Manpower Group processes and procedures, supporting MDM Supervisors on improvements. Additionally, the MDM Analyst will work collaboratively with internal and cross-functional Manpower Group teams at various levels to fulfill responsibilities. This role requires strong understanding of Master Data Management processes.




Core Responsabilities:




Responsible for the day-to-day Financial Planning, Accounting, Customer, Supplier & Vendor Master Data.
Collate and action requests for data creation and maintenance.
Maintain chart of accounts (including GL, cost centers and entities), other accounting master data objects, customer records and contracts data.
Apply subject matter knowledge to improve Master Data Management processes including, but not limited to, maintenance of chart of accounts, setting up new customers in system, enabling customers and vendors on invoicing and procurement portals.
Perform Master Data tasks with accuracy and completeness, for example, to always enter and maintain complete and comprehensive details in the systems.
Continually own and maintain required standard data documentation.
Apply a degree of independent decision-making in dealing with complex business and/or technical issues.
Collaborate with cross-functionals teams across various levels including the BPO.
Establish stable working relationships within Master Data team and with other departments/team members to ensure smooth ways of working and delivery of Master Data activities.
Collaborate with Finance process owners to adapt best practices and standards.




Technical Competencies:




Experience in roles specifically covering MDM processes.
A basic knowledge and understanding of the mechanics in the MDM process stream and how these fit into the end-to-end financial process environment.
Strong grasp of basic accounting concepts and how MDM processes impact MPG’s working capital targets and financial performance.

Show more

Title: Data QA Analyst
HTML:
Your connection with Aubay starts in the following lines:

Aubay Portugal is a multinational French company, in Portugal since 2007. We have offices in Lisbon and Oporto and we are a specialized consultant in Management, Implementation, Development and Maintenance of Information Systems. We have more than 150 active partners and we operate in sectors such as banking, insurance, telecommunications, services, energy and transports.


What are we looking for?

  • Experience (at least 3 years) in data testing and quality assurance (mandatory);
  • Proficiency in SQL databases (Mandatory);
  • Knowledge of automated testing tools (Selenium, Katalon);
  • Experience in Jira/Xray;
  • Fluent in English (Mandatory), French is a Plus;
  • Hybrid working regime.


What do we have to offer you?

  • Health Insurance;
  • Feedback&Coffee – the system that includes Aubay’s Performance Management Cycle, with regular moments of feedback and the Career Progression Model;
  • Working model: Hybrid;
  • A Training Academy designed to think of you and your needs. You can count on technical and behavioural training sessions (e-Learning and classroom), Meet&Techs, Webinars and Mentoring;
  • Events and Teambuildings.


What makes us different?

  • Our organizational culture is based on values such as transparency, team spirit, regular feedback and continuous learning;
  • Reference prizes and birthday present;
  • Lounge;
  • We don’t have a dress code;
  • We know your name and all address each other informally;
  • Coffee and varied snacks at your disposal;
  • You will grow in good company.Isn’t this one of the ways in which to develop professionally?


If we got your attention, we now hope to spark your enthusiasm. Ready for the first phase?

We are waiting for you at andre.b.eufrasio@aubay.pt.


We will use personal information that you have sent us to consider your application for the relevant function. By giving us your information/documents by email, you consent to Aubay Portugal treating your personal information. Your privacy is important to us. Please check our Privacy Policy, which explains how we will use and store your personal information. It also explains the rights you have regarding your information and how you can contact us for clarification of questions or requests.

Title: Financial Resources Data Analyst
Description:
About The Job

The Financial Resources Data Analyst plays an important and accountable role in providing support on the management of Global Markets Resources, namely Liquidity, Balance Sheet and Capital and the monitoring of future regulations.

The Financial Resources Data Analyst measures, allocates and optimizes Resources to ensure that the operational entity grows revenue, market share, and profitability in a sustainable way.

Your Main Activities Are


Collect, Prepare, consolidate data and Monitoring and keep track of Gaps on Global Markets Resources.
Responsible for database production and maintenance.
Assist on the preparation of presentations on topics related to Global Market resources.
Provides assistance to incoming requests from different regulators.
Responsible for producing GM Resources metrics, following a continuous improvement mindset (acquiring and building knowledge on the different business Lines, units and organization).
Develop knowledge on technical skills and apply those in order to efficiently perform the tasks.
Build knowledge and understanding on the 5 main types for Global markets and Help monitor those - Credit; Counterparty; Equity; Market; Operational.
Build knowledge and easiness in the main tools and software used by the team.


Profile And Skills To Success


Bachelors/MSc in Economics, Finance and Accounting
Very good communication skills
Analytical ability, attention to details, autonomy
Ability to collaborate/Teamwork
Proactivity
Risk management - Risk analysis
Technical skills – R, VBA and Python


Show more

Title: Data Analyst (0 Experience Required)
Description:
For thousands of years, maps have provided humans with the knowledge they need to make decisions. As a Maps Evaluator, you will have the opportunity to provide ground truth for your town, city or country.




At Peroptyx, we are looking for Data Analysts who will review mapping data for digital mapping applications. Your research capabilities will validate and ensure that the navigation of certain routes are accurate and safe.




As part of this role you will verify that business names and opening hours are correct. You will check that the distance from a starting point to an end destination is listed accurately resulting in better user experiences.




With this job you can plan your days around this highly flexible working schedule, work weekends or late evenings, all from the comfort of your own office. The flexibility of our roles minimizes the impact on your daily routine.




So, whether you are a student looking to earn as you learn, a retiree looking for a new challenge a part-time/full time professional or a work from home parent, Peroptyx has the right role for you!




Benefits

Work up to 20 hours per week.
Earn an incentive of €50 for passing the entrance exam by the 9th of October*
Earn a competitive rate of pay.
Develop your research skills.
Avoid the long commute.
Work from the comfort of your home office.
Enjoy the flexibility of setting your own working hours!




Ideal Candidate

Fluent in English and Portugese.
Excellent research skills.
Excellent local knowledge of your home country.
Good understanding and general knowledge of the geography and culture of Portugal.
Analytical mindset.




Job Requirements

Must be living in Portugal for a minimum of 5 consecutive years.
Must pass an online open-book exam that can verify your full understanding of the material and concepts.
Must be willing to work a minimum of 10 hours and up to 20 hours per week depending on task availability.
Good working knowledge of search engines, map applications and familiarity with social media platforms.
Strong ability to learn, understand and apply multiple sets of different instructions.
All work must be of an independent nature.







T&C's apply*




Apply Online Today!
